metadata.description: Location for all resources.

The gallery that the workbook will been shown under. Supported values include workbook, tsg, etc. Usually, this is 'workbook'
The unique guid for this workbook instance
The friendly name for the workbook that is used in the Gallery or Saved List.  This name must be unique within a resource group.
The unique guid for this workbook instance
The e-mail address of the SOC for reporting deletion of a honeytoken

Choose the service plan for the Azure function that deploys honeytokens at scale. This function requires permissions to key-vault on behalf of the user running it. Premium plan has a higher cost, and would allow you to configure some features (like assigning the function a specific IP/domain) that are more desirable from security perspective.
A unique name for the function app used for deploying key-vault honeytokens at scale

Please specify the location of the resource group of the KeyVault of the secret of the registered app
Please provide the name of the secret in KV holding the app secret here

A comma-separated list of keywords to use in  generated honeytoken key-vault key names, e.g. prod,dev,key,...
A comma-separated list of keywords to use in generated honeytoken key-vault secret names, e.g. prod,dev,key,...
The probability to use for installing an additional honeytoken into the same key-vault

parameters.name: ResourceSubscriptions
parameters.label: Resource Subscriptions
parameters.query:
SecurityIncident
| where Title startswith "HoneyTokens"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by IncidentName, IncidentNumber, IncidentUrl
| mvexpand AlertIds to typeof(string)
| join kind=inner (SecurityAlert) on $left.AlertIds == $right.SystemAlertId
| mv-apply ent = todynamic(Entities) on
    (
    where ent.Type == "azure-resource"
    | project KeyVault=ent.ResourceId
    | parse KeyVault with '/SUBSCRIPTIONS/' KeyVaultSubscriptionId '/RESOURCEGROUPS/' *
    )
| distinct KeyVaultSubscriptionId
| project strcat('/subscriptions/', tolower(KeyVaultSubscriptionId))

content.json: Select one of the following honeytoken incidents to investigate:

content.query:
SecurityIncident
| where Title startswith "HoneyTokens"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by IncidentName, IncidentNumber, IncidentUrl
| mvexpand AlertIds to typeof(string)
| join kind=inner (SecurityAlert) on $left.AlertIds == $right.SystemAlertId
| parse IncidentUrl with * "/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/" WorkspaceName "/providers/Microsoft.SecurityInsights/Incidents/" *
| project WorkspaceSubscriptionId, WorkspaceResourceGroup, WorkspaceName, IncidentNumber, IncidentUrl, TimeGenerated, Status, Severity, Classification, AlertsCount=toint(AdditionalData.alertsCount), Entities, CustomDetails=todynamic(tostring(todynamic(ExtendedProperties)["Custom Details"]))
| extend HoneyTokenName=CustomDetails.HoneyTokenName, OperationsPerformed=CustomDetails.OperationsPerformed
| mvexpand HoneyTokenName
| mvexpand OperationsPerformed
| mvexpand todynamic(tostring(OperationsPerformed))
| summarize make_set(OperationsPerformed) by WorkspaceSubscriptionId, WorkspaceResourceGroup, WorkspaceName, IncidentNumber, IncidentUrl, TimeGenerated, Status, Severity, Classification, AlertsCount, Entities, HoneyTokenName=tostring(HoneyTokenName)
| mv-apply ent = todynamic(Entities) on
    (
    where ent.Type == "azure-resource"
    | project KeyVault=ent.ResourceId
    | parse KeyVault with '/SUBSCRIPTIONS/' KeyVaultSubscriptionId '/RESOURCEGROUPS/' *
    )
| extend OperationsPerformed = set_OperationsPerformed
| project WorkspaceSubscriptionId, WorkspaceResourceGroup, WorkspaceName, IncidentNumber, IncidentUrl, TimeGenerated, Status, Severity, AlertsCount, KeyVaultSubscriptionId, KeyVault, HoneyTokenName, OperationsPerformed, Entities, Classification
| extend KVName=split(KeyVault, "/")[-1]
| where strcat('/subscriptions/', tolower(KeyVaultSubscriptionId)) in ({ResourceSubscriptions})
| summarize Entities=make_set(todynamic(Entities)), HoneyTokenNames=make_set(HoneyTokenName) by WorkspaceSubscriptionId,
WorkspaceResourceGroup,
WorkspaceName,
IncidentNumber,	
IncidentUrl,	
TimeGenerated,	
Status,	
Severity,	
AlertsCount,	
KeyVaultSubscriptionId,	
tostring(KeyVault),	
OperationsPerformed=replace_string(replace_string(tostring(OperationsPerformed),'[',''),']',''),	
Classification,	
tostring(KVName)

content.json:
Step 1: Validate the activity in the logs:

This section presents the activity related to the entities in the alert within the selected time window around the alert.
  • Can you identify suspicious or unexpected activity?
Select one of the incident entities to investigate:

content.query:
print Entities=dynamic({Entities})
| mv-expand Entities
| project EntityType=tostring(Entities.Type), Entity=tostring(Entities[tostring(bag_keys(Entities)[1])])

parameters.name: TimeWin
parameters.label: Time window
parameters.description: Time window in days to search around the alert
parameters.query:
print TimeWin=range(1d, 7d, 1d)
| mv-expand TimeWin 
| extend TimeWin=totimespan(TimeWin)
| extend TimeWinText=strcat(toint(TimeWin/1d), iff(TimeWin == 1d, ' day ',' days '))//, toint(TimeWin/1d-toint(TimeWin/1d))*24, ' hours')

parameters.name: EmailContent
parameters.query:
print Subject="SOC inquiry",
Body="Dear User,

A suspicious activity was observed on your {SqlName} SQL server.
Please confirm you are aware of this activity, or contact us for assistance.

Thanks,
The SOC"
| project EmailContent=strcat('?subject=', Subject, '&body=', replace('
','%0d%0a',Body))

content.query:
let t = datetime({StartTime});
let timeWin = timespan({TimeWin});
AzureDiagnostics
| where TimeGenerated between ((t-timeWin) .. (t+timeWin))
| search "{Entity}"
| summarize min(TimeGenerated), count()
    by
    Category,
    Operation=OperationName,
    Caller=CallerIPAddress,
    ActivityStatus=iff(ResultType != 'Success', 'Other', ResultType)
| summarize
    ['Earliest Call']=min(min_TimeGenerated),
    ActivityStatus=make_list(pack('Status', ActivityStatus, 'Count', count_))
    by Category, Operation, Caller
| extend Chat = iff(Caller contains "@", "ðŸ’¬", "")
| extend ChatLink=strcat("https://teams.microsoft.com/l/chat/0/0?users=", Caller)
| extend Email= iff(Caller contains "@", "ðŸ“§", "")
| extend EmailLink=strcat("mailto:", Caller, "")
| project
    Category,
    Operation,
    ['Earliest Call'],
    Caller,
    Chat,
    ChatLink,
    Email,
    EmailLink,
    ActivityStatus
| mv-expand ActivityStatus 
| evaluate bag_unpack(ActivityStatus)
| union (print Status='dummy', Count=1
    | take 0) // force the columns existance
| evaluate pivot(Status, sum(Count))
| extend ['Activity Status'] = column_ifexists('Success', 0) + column_ifexists('Other', 0)
| union (print Success=0, Other=0
    | take 0)
content.title: Choose a record to present full details:

content.query:
let t = datetime({StartTime});
let timeWin = timespan({TimeWin});
AzureDiagnostics
| where TimeGenerated between ((t-timeWin) .. (t+timeWin))
| search "{Entity}"
| extend Operation=OperationName, Caller=CallerIPAddress
| where Operation == "{Operation}"
| where ("{Caller}" == "" and isempty(Caller)) or "{Caller}" == Caller
content.title: Full details
content.noDataMessage: Click a record on the left to see full details

content.json:
Step 2: Validate the activity with the relevant users


This section presents users with control plane activity (ARM) around the alert time.
  • Contact one of the users - can they explain the activity?

Select a user to contact regarding the activity:

content.query:
let t = datetime({StartTime});
let timeWin = timespan({TimeWin});
AzureActivity
| where TimeGenerated between ((t-timeWin) .. (t+timeWin))
| where ActivityStatusValue == "Succeeded"
| where SubscriptionId == "{SubscriptionId}"
| where Caller has '@'
| summarize latestActivity=max(TimeGenerated) by Caller, hasAccessedResourceGroup=(ResourceGroup == "{ResourceGroup}"), hasAccessedResource=(ResourceId == "{KVId}")
| extend Chat = iff(isnotempty(Caller),"ðŸ’¬","")
| extend ChatLink=strcat("https://teams.microsoft.com/l/chat/0/0?users=", Caller)
| extend Email= iff(isnotempty(Caller),"ðŸ“§","")
| extend EmailLink=strcat("mailto:",Caller,"{EmailContent}")
| order by hasAccessedResource desc, hasAccessedResourceGroup desc, latestActivity desc
| project-rename ['Accessed Resource']=hasAccessedResource, ['Accessed Resource Group']=hasAccessedResourceGroup
| take 10

properties.description: A honeytoken key-vault key was accessed
properties.query:
[concat('let timeframe=5m;
let fullAzureLogs = 
    (AzureDiagnostics
    | union (print TimeGenerated=now(), ResourceType="", OperationName="", ResourceId="", requestUri_s="", 
    CallerIPAddress="", identity_claim_http_schemas_microsoft_com_identity_claims_objectidentifier_g="", 
    identity_claim_http_schemas_xmlsoap_org_ws_2005_05_identity_claims_name_s="" | take 0))
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(timeframe)
    | where ResourceType == "VAULTS"
    | where OperationName !in ("KeyNearExpiryEventGridNotification", "KeyExpiredEventGridNotification", "KeyNewVersionEventGridNotification", "KeyBackup", "KeyCreate", "KeyList", "KeyRestore", "KeyResourcePut", "KeyResourceGet", "KeyResourceList", "KeyRecover", "KeyGetDeleted")
    | project ResourceId=toupper(ResourceId), requestUri_s, OperationName, CallerIPAddress
        , AccountObjectId=identity_claim_http_schemas_microsoft_com_identity_claims_objectidentifier_g, AccountUPN=identity_claim_http_schemas_xmlsoap_org_ws_2005_05_identity_claims_name_s
    | parse kind=regex flags=U requestUri_s with "https://" KVName "', environment().suffixes.keyvaultDns, '/keys/" HoneyToken "[?|/]" *
    | parse kind=regex requestUri_s with "', environment().authentication.audiences[1],'" * "/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/" KVName2 "/keys/" HoneyToken2 "[?|/]" *   
    | extend KVName=iff(isempty(KVName), KVName2, KVName), HoneyToken=toupper(iff(isempty(HoneyToken), HoneyToken2, HoneyToken));
// basic alert on honeytoken access
fullAzureLogs
| join kind=inner (
    (_GetWatchlist("HoneyTokens") 
    | union (print ResourceProvider="",ResourceId="",HoneyToken="",Properties="{}" | take 0))
    | where todynamic(Properties).Type == "key"
    | extend ResourceId=toupper(ResourceId), HoneyToken=toupper(HoneyToken)
    )
    on ResourceId, HoneyToken
| summarize make_set(OperationName) by ResourceId, HoneyToken, CallerIPAddress, AccountObjectId, AccountUPN
// enrich with Account that accessed the KV at this time if available
| join kind=leftouter (fullAzureLogs
    | distinct ResourceId, AccountObjectId, AccountUPN
    | where isnotempty(AccountObjectId))
    on ResourceId
| project ResourceId, HoneyToken, set_OperationName, CallerIPAddress, 
    AccountObjectId=iff(isempty(AccountObjectId), AccountObjectId1, AccountObjectId), 
    AccountUPN=iff(isempty(AccountUPN), AccountUPN1, AccountUPN)
| extend AccountName=tostring(split(AccountUPN, "@")[0]), UPNSuffix=tostring(split(AccountUPN, "@")[1])
| extend Severity=iff(set_OperationName contains "/decrypt?","High", "Medium")')]

properties.description: A honeytoken key-vault secret was accessed
properties.query:
[concat('let timeframe=5m;
let fullAzureLogs =
(AzureDiagnostics
| union (print TimeGenerated=now(), ResourceType="", OperationName="", ResourceId="", requestUri_s="",
CallerIPAddress="", identity_claim_oid_g="",
identity_claim_upn_s="" | take 0))
| where TimeGenerated > ago(timeframe)
| where ResourceType == "VAULTS"
| where OperationName in ("SecretGet", "SecretDelete")
| project ResourceId=toupper(ResourceId), requestUri_s, OperationName, CallerIPAddress
, AccountObjectId=identity_claim_oid_g
, AccountUPN=identity_claim_upn_s
| parse kind=regex flags=U requestUri_s with "https://" KVName "', environment().suffixes.keyvaultDns, '/secrets/" HoneyToken "[?|/]" *
| parse kind=regex requestUri_s with "', environment().authentication.audiences[1] ,'" * "/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/" KVName2 "/secrets/" HoneyToken2 "[?|/]" *
| extend KVName=iff(isempty(KVName), KVName2, KVName), HoneyToken=toupper(iff(isempty(HoneyToken), HoneyToken2, HoneyToken));
// basic alert on honeytoken access
fullAzureLogs
| join kind=inner (
(_GetWatchlist("HoneyTokens") 
| union (print ResourceProvider="",ResourceId="",HoneyToken="",Properties="{}" | take 0))
| where todynamic(Properties).Type == "secret"
| extend ResourceId=toupper(ResourceId), HoneyToken=toupper(HoneyToken)
)
on ResourceId, HoneyToken
| summarize make_set(OperationName) by ResourceId, HoneyToken, CallerIPAddress, AccountObjectId, AccountUPN
// enrich with Account that accessed the KV at this time if available
| join kind=leftouter (fullAzureLogs
| distinct ResourceId, AccountObjectId, AccountUPN
| where isnotempty(AccountObjectId))
on ResourceId
| project ResourceId, HoneyToken, set_OperationName, CallerIPAddress,AccountObjectId,AccountUPN
| extend AccountName=tostring(split(AccountUPN, "@")[0]), UPNSuffix=tostring(split(AccountUPN, "@")[1])')]

properties.displayName: HoneyTokens: KeyVault HoneyToken diagnostic settings deleted or changed
properties.description:
This alert pops if any of the following two happen:
1. diagnostic settings for a honey token keyvault is deleted.
2. diagnostic settings  a honey token keyvault are changed such that "AuditEvent" is turned off.
properties.query:
let timeframe=5m;
AzureActivity | where TimeGenerated > ago(timeframe) | where ResourceProviderValue == "MICROSOFT.KEYVAULT"
| extend d=parse_json(Properties)
| extend requestBodyProperties=parse_json(tostring(d.requestbody)).properties
| extend logs=parse_json(tostring(requestBodyProperties)).logs
| where todynamic(Properties).message == "microsoft.insights/diagnosticSettings/delete" or (logs[0].category == "AuditEvent" and logs[0].enabled == false)
| project-away d, requestBodyProperties, logs
| parse kind=regex todynamic(Properties).entity with "/subscriptions/" * "/resourceGroups/" * "/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/" keyvault "/providers/microsoft.insights/diagnosticSettings/" diagnosticSettingsName | extend keyvault, diagnosticSettingsName
| join kind=inner (_GetWatchlist('HoneyTokens') | union (print ResourceProvider="dummy", ResourceId="dummy", HoneyToken="dummy")
| parse kind=regex ResourceId with "/subscriptions/" * "/resourceGroups/" * "/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/" keyvault
| distinct keyvault) on keyvault
| extend ResourceId = _ResourceId, AccountUPN = Caller | extend AccountName = tostring(split(AccountUPN, '@')[0]), UPNSuffix=tostring(split(AccountUPN, '@')[1]), Severity="High", AccountObjectId=todynamic(Claims)['http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/objectidentifier']

variables.name: query
variables.value: _GetWatchlist('HoneyTokens') | union (print ResourceProvider="dummy", ResourceId="dummy", HoneyToken="dummy")| where tolower(ResourceProvider) == 'microsoft.keyvault' | where ResourceId in (@{body('Parse_JSON')?['allKVIds']}) | summarize by ResourceId | union (print ResourceId="_dummy")

inputs.body: Honeytoken was successfully added to monitored list

variables.name: armTemplate
